title: Jordyn Woods on being papped for first time aged 13
text:
Jordyn Woods has cute freckles that inspire many of Sian’s clients (Picture: Phillip Faraone/Getty Images for Twenty)

Jordyn Woods has reflected on the moment that changed her life, after she was called fat by trolls aged 13 when a photo surfaced of her with Willow Smith.

The 22-year-old has revealed the effect it had on her, as she opened up in her first YouTube video.

Speaking about ‘growing up the bigger girl’, the woman formerly known as Kylie Jenner’s best friend opened up about realising she was ‘different’ from everyone else.

‘I always grew up the bigger girl, the taller one, and as you get older you get more and more self-conscious,’ she said this week.

‘When you’re young you don’t care as much… but it would be the little things like going to pool parties.’

It was soon the comments began, though, with some people feeling it appropriate to say Jordyn ‘will be pretty once she loses all the baby fat’.

Because that’s nice.

The model continued: ‘As time goes on you get so comfortable with accepting that’s who you are… I was comfortable with being in the background and not caring to fit in.’

Revealing one shot taken of her with Willow – who is the daughter of Will Smith and a family friend of the Woods – at The Grove in 2010, even now, nearly 10 years later, made Jordyn nervous.

In it, she’s seen walking behind Willow, who is naturally more slender and has a petite frame, compared to Jordyn, who is a taller five foot nine.

‘I don’t know why I thought it was a good idea to wear this. This outfit… this is a big no,’ she said, revealing it was the first time she had been papped.

Jordyn, here in 2016, found fame as a plus-size model (Picture: Getty Images for Addition Elle)

The star, here ahead of her 22nd birthday this month, found confidence in her body thanks to trolls (Picture: Instagram / @jordynwoods)

While she had years ahead of her in the public spotlight to come, it was the comments from that one photo of her, as a teenager, that cut deep.

‘I remember reading the comments and tears just started coming out of my eyes,’ she said, not knowing what it was like to have a stranger take her photo and for it to land on the internet.

Jordyn added: ‘It broke me, I knew I was unhappy with the way that I looked… that was my lowest point.’

Advertisement

She said ‘that moment about being completely heartbroken’ had its silver lining in that it shifted her to find the confidence that she has today.

Jordyn was best friends with Kylie (Picture: 2018 Getty Images)

Adding she read self-help books, it wasn’t long before she learned to embrace her individuality and in guiding her followers down the same path, she enthused: ‘You’re given this body for a reason.

‘I realised that my purpose is much bigger than me.’

Going on a health kick following the death of her father when she was 19, Jordyn continued: ‘I lost probably 30lbs in a matter of five months and I felt great.’

However Jordyn recently spoke about how she was ‘skinny-shamed’ after losing the weight.

She told Women’s Health: ‘When I lost my dad, I turned to working out as a form of therapy but because I’m a curvy model, once I started working out a lot, people thought that I was doing it to try to look different.’

She added: ‘Someone actually called me and said: “Jordyn, you’re getting too skinny!” But “skinny” has never been my goal. My ultimate goal is health.

‘I constantly see people commenting, “Oh, you’re losing weight now? I used to support you, but now I don’t.”’

The star recently spent her 22nd birthday twerking with Jaden Smith and his little sister Willow, brushing aside the drama around her kiss with Tristan Thompson – while he was still with Kylie’s older sister Khloe Kardashian.

Advertisement

The party was held on a stunning balcony overlooking Los Angeles, and Jordyn had ensured there was a bar on hand to make all her guests cocktails.

Her birthday is the first that Jordyn has spent without Kylie since the two met, but if she was missing her former BFF, she didn’t let it show.
